• Severity: Critical
• Device Status: Failed

Primary cause: Ambient temperature too high causing elevated operating temperature. Contributing factors: Possible extended duty cycle or inadequate ventilation. Confidence level: 91%

## TROUBLESHOOTING STEPS
1. IMMEDIATE: Power down device and allow 15-minute cooling period | 2. Inspect ventilation ports for obstructions or dust buildup | 3. Verify cooling fan operation (should run at 3000 RPM ±5%) | 4. Check thermal sensor calibration against reference thermometer | 5. If issue persists, replace cooling assembly per service manual Section 4.2

• Patient Risk: High
• Continue Use: No - Stop operation
